Title: Electoral Consequences of Policy Ambiguity
Abstract: What are the electoral consequences when politicians take ambiguous positions on key policy issues? We develop a theory of strategic ambiguity and test it using survey experiments in the US context.

Title: Youth Political Socialization in Digital Environments
Abstract: How do social media platforms shape the political attitudes of young Americans? We analyze panel data from a longitudinal study of high school students.

Title: Bureaucratic Responsiveness to Citizen Requests
Abstract: Using a field experiment, we test whether local bureaucrats respond differently to citizen service requests based on the perceived race and class of the requester.

Title: Campaign Finance and Legislative Behavior
Abstract: Does campaign finance influence how legislators vote? We leverage a natural experiment created by changes in donation limits across states.
Keywords: campaign finance, legislative behavior, causal inference

Title: Partisan Media and Affective Polarization
Abstract: We examine whether exposure to partisan media increases affective polarization using a pre-registered longitudinal design.
Notes: Survey data collected - need to clean

Title: Representation Gaps in Local Government
Abstract: Do local officials accurately perceive constituent preferences? We survey both citizens and local officials in a sample of US municipalities.
Notes: Initial idea - need to develop theory
